title: Design and Benchmarking of Interaction Models Between Universities and Local Communities

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics knowledge and understanding of educational systems
context.additional_context: Learners are professionals (medical/legal/technical) interested in mathematical modeling for regional education system improvement.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the five core components of an interaction model between universities and local communities.
Learners can evaluate qualitative elements of an educational system using benchmarking techniques.
Learners can design and simulate a math-based interaction model in mobile environments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
